∫u dv = uv - ∫v du

In this case, we can let u = ln(x) and dv = (1+x)dx. Then, we find du and v by differentiating and integrating:

du = (1/x)dx
v = x + (1/2)x^2

Now we can apply the integration by parts formula:

∫ln(x)*(1+x)dx = ln(x)*(x + (1/2)x^2) - ∫(x + (1/2)x^2)*(1/x)dx
∫ln(x)*(1+x)dx = x*ln(x) + (1/2)x^2*ln(x) - ∫(1 + (1/2)x)dx
∫ln(x)*(1+x)dx = x*ln(x) + (1/2)x^2*ln(x) - x - (1/4)x^2 + C

∫ln(x)*(1+x)dx = 4*ln(4) + 8*ln(4) - 4 - 4
∫ln(x)*(1+x)dx = 12*ln(4) - 8
